channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: Daylight saving time: These states want to stop changing the clocks
item.description: Nearly every state has considered legislation that would lock the clocks — here's where those efforts stand.
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Supplements sold at Sam's Club nationwide linked to salmonella outbreak: FDA
item.description: Illnesses connected to using the product have been reported in Kansas, Florida, South Carolina, North Carolina, Virginia, New York and Michigan. Three people who contracted salmonella were hospitalized, according to the CDC.
item.dc:creator: Kyler Swaim, WFLA, NBC

item.title: US national intelligence director says former American strategy of 'regime change' is over
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The U.S. national intelligence director told officials Friday in the Mideast that America’s former strategy of “regime change or nation building” had ended under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Travel delays were adding up at airports across the U.S. on Friday as the government shutdown drags on, putting even more pressure on air traffic controllers who have been working without pay for a month. U.S.
item.dc:creator: RIO YAMAT, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: FBI says shooter in deadly Michigan church attack was motivated by hatred toward the Mormon faith
item.description: LANSING, Mich. (AP) — The former Marine who opened fire in a Michigan church and set it ablaze last month was motivated by “anti-religious beliefs” against The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, the FBI confirmed Friday.
item.dc:creator: ISABELLA VOLMERT and HANNAH SCHOENBAUM, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Trump signals he'll fund SNAP
item.description: President Trump indicated Friday he would fund the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) if given "the appropriate legal direction" after a federal judge ordered officials to spend an emergency fund for the program.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, NewsNation

item.title: ICE officer shoots illegal immigrant during Phoenix traffic stop gone wrong, both hospitalized
item.description: ICE officer and Honduran man injured in Phoenix shooting during traffic stop. Jose Garcia-Sorto hospitalized in stable condition after Interstate 17 incident.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Disney pulls ABC, ESPN and more from YouTube TV as talks break down
item.description: YouTube TV viewers can no longer see Disney channels including ABC and ESPN after the two sides failed to agree on a new content distribution deal. Other channels that vanished from Google's pay TV platform include the Disney Channel, FX and Nat Geo.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Judges order the Trump administration to use contingency funds for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: Two judges could rule as soon as Friday on whether President Donald Trump's administration must replenish SNAP food aid benefits for November despite the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Alabama man charged with threatening rabbis, imam and others in multiple Southern states
item.description: MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) — Federal prosecutors have charged an Alabama man with making threatening calls and texts to multiple rabbis, an imam and others in the South, including telling one rabbi that “I want you to die.
item.dc:creator: KIM CHANDLER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Young adults turn to Quakers' silent worship to offset
item.description: PHILADELPHIA (AP) — At the Arch Street Meeting House in Philadelphia's Old City, more and more young people are seeking respite from a clamorous technological age in the silent worship of a centuries-old faith. Like other Quaker houses of worship, it follows values of simplicity and equality.
item.dc:creator: LUIS ANDRES HENAO, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Cannabis use may boost tobacco addiction risk in young Americans, study finds
item.description: New research from UC San Diego found that cannabis use among youth may be responsible for 13% of new cases of regular tobacco use in the US, suggesting that cannabis use should be considered a major risk factor for later tobacco addiction.
item.dc:creator: Amber Coakley, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Photos: Trumps host Halloween event at White House
item.description: President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump hosted trick-or-treaters on Thursday in a Halloween celebration that has become a fun White House tradition.
item.dc:creator: The Hill, WGN 9

item.title: DC Mayor Bowser says residents will receive SNAP, WIC benefits in November
item.description: Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser (D) on Thursday said the city will fund the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and the separate program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) for the month of November amid the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, KRON4

item.title: A 3rd teenager is indicted for the killing of a congressional intern in Washington
item.description: A third teenager has been arrested and charged with the killing of a congressional intern in the nation's capital, a crime that President Donald Trump cited when he announced a law enforcement surge in Washington.
item.dc:creator: AUDREY McAVOY, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: 2 die in flooded New York City basements during heavy rainstorm
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Two people died in flooded New York City basements Thursday during a rainstorm that shut down roadways and caused airport delays, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Man, 39, dies after being pulled from flooded Brooklyn basement: NYPD
item.description: EAST FLATBUSH, Brooklyn (PIX11) — A man died after he was pulled from a flooded basement in Brooklyn as New York City was hit with a historic storm, according to the NYPD. A call came in for a reported person trapped in a flooded basement at 564 Kingston Ave. in East Flatbush at 4:25 p.m.
item.dc:creator: Video credit: Zhané Caldwell, NewsNation

item.title: National Guard in each state is ordered to create 'quick reaction forces' trained in civil unrest
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Military leaders have ordered the National Guard in every state to develop a “quick reaction force” of troops trained to deal with civil disturbances and riots that can be ready to deploy with just hours' notice, the latest indication of longer-term Trump administration plans to mo
item.dc:creator: KONSTANTIN TOROPIN, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Suspect in custody after shooting at officers from inside Addison home
item.description: A suspect is in custody after he reportedly fired shots at police officers from inside an Addison home.
item.dc:creator: Ethan Illers, NewsNation

item.title: RFK Jr. says no 'sufficient' evidence Tylenol definitively causes autism
item.description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said there is not “sufficient” evidence that Tylenol causes autism, softening warnings he and President Trump have repeatedly made to discourage the medicine's use by pregnant women and young children.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Weixel, NewsNation

item.title: Utah man accused of throwing 6 puppies out of car on highway, killing 2 of them
item.description: Memphis Lor, 25, was arrested on seven counts of torturing a companion animal, a third-degree felony. He has not been formally charged.
item.dc:creator: Sorina Trauntvein, NewsNation

item.title: Pair get prison for assaulting restaurant host over where they were seated
item.description: The teenager who was attacked said the trouble began after he finally got them all seated at the one large table.
item.dc:creator: Sarai Bennett, NewsNation

item.title: Maryland state senator indicted in alleged scheme involving filming critic in bed
item.description: State Sen. Dalya Attar (D), her brother and a Baltimore police officer each face eight counts, including extortion and conspiracy charges.
item.dc:creator: Zach Schonfeld, NewsNation

item.title: Parents of Nashville school shooting victims fight to keep records out of public view
item.description: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) — The parents of children killed in a shooting at a private Christian school in Nashville are fighting to keep police investigative records a secret, even after many documents were leaked to a conservative media outlet.
item.dc:creator: TRAVIS LOLLER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Chicago father of child fighting cancer released on bond by immigration judge
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — A Chicago man whose 16-year-old daughter is undergoing treatment for advanced cancer will be released on bond and return home, an immigration judge ruled Thursday. Attorneys for Ruben Torres Maldonado, a 40-year-old painter and home renovator who was detained Oct.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Cop's testimony, judge's instructions influenced outcome of Sonya Massey murder case
item.description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill. (AP) — The killing of Sonya Massey in her home by an Illinois sheriff's deputy was pursued by prosecutors as a first-degree murder case with a possible life prison sentence. Then the judge gave the jury another option when deliberations began this week.
item.dc:creator: JOHN O'CONNOR and ED WHITE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: FBI: U.S. Marine kidnapped, sexually assaulted 12-year-old Indiana girl
item.description: (WXIN/WTTV) — An active-duty U.S. Marine has been arrested after police say he traveled from North Carolina to Indiana to kidnap and sexually assault a 12-year-old girl from Lake County. William Richard Roy was arrested Sunday in Durham, North Carolina, after being tracked down by FBI officials.
item.dc:creator: WGN 9

item.title: CBP seizes 166 exotic pets, including pythons and tarantulas, from car traveling to Mexico
item.description: A total of 166 reptiles and arthropods were identified within the vehicle, including dozens of pythons, numerous lizards, multiple frogs and several tarantulas.
item.dc:creator: Mia Morales, KRON4

item.title: GM lays off 1,700 workers at plants in Michigan and Ohio amid slower EV demand
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — General Motors is laying off about 1,700 workers across manufacturing sites in Michigan and Ohio, as the auto giant adjusts to slowing demand for electric vehicles.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Cuomo hasn't condemned bigoted attacks on Mamdani. In 1977 race, his father took another approach
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — In 1977, at the tail end of another bruising battle for New York City mayor, Mario Cuomo publicly spoke up against bigoted remarks leveled at his opponent. Almost 50 years later, his son is taking a different approach.
item.dc:creator: JAKE OFFENHARTZ, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Wall Street Journal urges GOP to kill ObamaCare subsidies
item.description: The editorial board of The Wall Street Journal is urging Republicans in Congress to end health care subsidies introduced as part of ObamaCare as the party tries to negotiate an end to the government shutdown, which has stretched into its fourth week.
item.dc:creator: Dominick Mastrangelo, Fox 5

item.title: Video shows dramatic rescue of woman from car submerged in South Carolina pond
item.description: HORRY COUNTY, S.C. (WBTW) – Video obtained by Nexstar's WBTW shows South Carolina first responders and bystanders rescuing a woman from a car partially submerged in a pond along a highway bypass in Horry County Tuesday afternoon.
item.dc:creator: Dennis Bright, WGN 9

item.title: Colleges feel the weight of Supreme Court affirmative action decision as Black enrollment falls
item.description: Two years after the Supreme Court ruled to abolish affirmative action in higher education admissions, Black enrollment at selective universities is down, Asian American enrollment is up and the implications of the decision are becoming clearer.
item.dc:creator: Lexi Lonas Cochran, Fox 5
